sen.j: 脇坂 安教（わきさか やすのり、宝暦12年（1762年） - 天明元年6月29日 (旧暦)（1781年8月18日））は、播磨国龍野藩の世嗣。
sen.e: Yasunori WAKISAKA (1762 - August 18, 1781) was a successor of the Tatsuno Domain of Harima Province.
Yasunori WAKISAKA (1762 - August 18, 1781) was a successor of Tatsuno Domain of Harima Province.
Yasunori WAKISAKA (1762 - August 18, 1781) was a successor of Tatsuno Domain of Harima Province.

sen.j: 第7代藩主・脇坂安親の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of the seventh lord, Yasuchika WAKISAKA.
He was the first son of the seventh lord, Yasuchika WAKISAKA.
He was the first son of the seventh lord, Yasuchika WAKISAKA.
His mother was a daughter of Yoshimasa UEDA.
His mother was a daughter of Yoshimasa UEDA.
His mother was a daughter of Yoshimasa UEDA.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、近江国守。
sen.e: He was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of Omi Province).
He was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of Omi Province).
He was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of Omi Province).

sen.j: 龍野藩嫡子として生まれ、安永6年（1777年）徳川家治に拝謁し叙任する。
sen.e: He was born as a legitimate son and the successor of the Tatsuno Domain, was granted an audience with Ieharu TOKUGAWA in 1777, and was appointed to Jugoinoge.
He was born as a legitimate son and the successor of Tatsuno Domain, was granted an audience with Ieharu TOKUGAWA in 1777, and was appointed to Jugoinoge.
He was born as a legitimate son and the successor of Tatsuno Domain, was granted an audience with Ieharu TOKUGAWA in 1777, and was appointed to Jugoinoge.

sen.j: しかし、家督を継ぐことなく天明元年（1781年）に20歳で早世した。
sen.e: He however died in 1781 at the age of 20 before taking over the family.
He however died in 1781 at the age of 20 before taking over the family.
He however died in 1781 at the age of 20 before taking over the family.

sen.j: 代わって、弟の脇坂安董が嫡子となった。
sen.e: As a replacement, his younger brother Yasutada WAKISAKA became the legitimate son as the successor.
As a replacement, his younger brother Yasutada WAKISAKA became the legitimate son as the successor.
As a replacement, his younger brother Yasutada WAKISAKA became the legitimate son as the successor.
